title:en-US: Here's a curated list of badges used in trending GitHub projects, along with online tools to create them.

description:en-US: Badges are small images that can be embedded in a project's README file to convey information about the project's status, version, test coverage, and more.

steps:en-US: Refer to the [template.json](/badges/template.json) file, create a JSON file in the [badges](/badges) directory, and fill in the badge information according to the template format.
`pnpm dev` or `pnpm dev:docs` to start the project, check the badge effect.
Use the `pnpm commit` command and select `docs` to submit a PR, wait for merging.

steps:en-US: Add a new language configuration to the `locales` field in the [meta.json](/meta.json) configuration file.
Add a translated version of the badge information file to the [locales](/locales) directory.
Use the `pnpm commit` command and select `docs` to submit a PR, wait for merging.
